lines.content: This is a greenfield Java project for CS2103. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `...plugin/src/main/java/Duke/DukeEntryPoint.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run current file` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* todo task description (add a todo to list)
* event task description /at yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm (add an event)
* deadline task description /at yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm (add a task)
* mark index (mark the task at that index)
* delete index (delete task at that index)
* find keyword (finds task containing that keyword)
### Easy to use GUI with extensive usages
Cute beaver helps you to manage your tasks!
A list of all tasks on the todo list
### `todo` - Adds a todo to task list
Adds a task to the end of the task list
### `event` - Adds new Event to task list
Adds new event to the end of the task list
### `deadline` - Adds new Deadline to task list
Adds new deadline to the end of the task list
### `mark` - Marks or unmarks a task as done
Marks a task at that index as done
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
:( Stop procrastinating! I've marked it as undone.
Deletes a task from the task list at the specified index
Wow! Good job, I have removed the following task:
Returns all tasks containing that substring
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
### `reminder` - Returns the task with the nearest, valid deadline
Returns the expected time till the task expires

EXIT("Goodbye! Hope to see you soon!"),
FOUND("Here are the matching tasks in your list:"),
MARK_DONE("Nice! I've marked this task as done:"),
MARK_UNDONE(":( Stop Procrastinating! I've marked it as undone."),
